hook.text: Stalin's USSR controlled what you read, said, and thought. Total power over total life.

buildup.text: Totalitarianism goes beyond authoritarianism. The state controls politics and all of society.

discovery.text: Nazi Germany and Maoist China used propaganda, surveillance, and terror to reshape human behavior.

twist.text: Orwell's 1984 was based on real regimes. Thought police weren't fiction â€” they were fact.

climax.text: Totalitarianism is rare but devastating. Tens of millions died under Stalin, Hitler, and Mao.

punchline.text: Authoritarians want obedience. Totalitarians want your soul.

quiz.question: How does totalitarianism differ from authoritarianism?
options: It controls all of society, not just politics
